message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR. 

This paper is about improving sentiment classification through domain adaptation, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel deep learning approach involving multiple components, such as feature extractors, sentiment classifiers, and domain discriminators, which suggests that it may fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) as well. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of label probers to guide the learning of the feature extractor, which is a form of active learning and may relate to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also uses multiple datasets and evaluates the performance of the proposed approach, which may indicate cs.CV (Computer Vision) or cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as possible sub-categories.
